"Otro texto de la nueva dramaturgia uruguaya", La Nación, Buenos Aires, 12 October 2018. Retrieved 12 March 2020. == Early life == Chiarino was born in Montevideo, Uruguay. He began his formal acting studies in Montevideo at the Escuela Multidisciplinaria de Arte Dramático (EMAD) (formerly, Escuela Municipal de Arte Dramático) completed in 2005 and the Escuela de Cine del Uruguay (Film School of Uruguay) completed in 2006. == Career == Chiarino started his artistic career as a stage actor in his home country, Uruguay. He made his film acting debut in the drama Masángeles (2008). Subsequently, he was cast in various Spanish speaking films such as Cinco (2010), La culpa del cordero (2012), La máquina que escupe monstruos y la chica de mis sueños (2012), and Thesis on a Homicide (2013). Chiarino is known for his lead role in the Hawaii (2013) film in which he gained international attention from viewers.van Hoei, Boyd.
